issue.title: https://www.ima-usa.com/collections/stg-44-mp-44
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

ublock

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

comment.body:
@metametapod High quality filtering is impossible on iOS and Safari - we cannot use our filtering lib to filter traffic like on Android or desktops. We can use only Safari Content Blocking API (it is like very first version of AdBlock many years ago) + our implementation for advanced rules (may work unstable, because applied not as native rules).

AdGuard for Mac can apply all rules.

issue.title: war.pe
issue.body:
> @Sergey-Lyapin @Alex-302  Se bloqueó el script war.pe/warp.js, pero este fue creado únicamente para informar a los usuarios que si no tienen Warp activado pueden usarlo de forma gratuita. No contiene trackers ni realiza peticiones externas; solo verifica localmente si hay Warp usando el mismo endpoint de Cloudflare del sitio y muestra un aviso cerrable que solo enlaza a one.one.one.one (página oficial de Cloudflare). El script está alojado en warpe.pages.dev (Cloudflare Pages, solo contenido estático) y el dominio war.pe apunta ahí. El bloqueo afecta una función útil, segura y transparente. Este script no tiene que ver con la situación mostrada en este commit ni con ningún tipo de publicidad, simplemente recomienda al usuario el servicio gratuito de Cloudflare, por favor revisar para considerar revertirlo. 

 _Originally posted by @war-pe in [#202464](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/202464#issuecomment-2796686188)_

comment.body: Moved to the AdGuard Popups filter.

El script está alojado en warpe.pages.dev (Cloudflare Pages, solo contenido estático) y el dominio war.pe apunta ahí. El bloqueo afecta una función útil, segura y transparente. Este script no tiene que ver con la situación mostrada en este commit ni con ningún tipo de publicidad, simplemente recomienda al usuario el servicio gratuito de Cloudflare, por favor revisar para considerar revertirlo. 

 _Originally posted by @war-pe in [#202464](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/202464#issuecomment-2796686188)_

comment.body:
The second rule will be applied to every user, not only to those who see this "Gemini" banner. I would prefer a rule which would be applied only when "Gemini" banner is displayed.
Also it looks like that this banner is not often displayed (probably there were not any other reports about that or people don't think that it's really annoying), so maybe it would be better to keep these rules just in user rules (at least for now).
What if you click "Dismiss" and re-login, do you still see this banner?

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

5.0.219

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://travelbelka.ru/50-veshhej-kotorye-nado-znat-pered-vizitom-na-mavrikij/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

### Social Widgets

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

The issue is regarding the inclusion of domain tp.media in several AdGuard blocklists:
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/master/filters/filter_1_Russian/filter.txt
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/master/filters/filter_23_Ukrainian/filter.txt
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/master/filters/filter_2_Base/filter.txt
- https://adguardteam.github.io/AdGuardSDNSFilter/Filters/filter.txt

tp.media is the domain of Travelpayouts.com, a travel network operated by Aviasales.ru and Jetradar.com. We understand the blocking appears to be related to the GitHub issue [#201710](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/201710), concerning widget placement on nashaniva.com.

According to your filter policy, we would like to present the following information for your consideration:

1. Our widgets and links are content-enhancing tools that provide travel-related information and services within relevant editorial content. They are integrated into site content as elements of self-promotion and site-specific promotional activities. Each widget is added manually by the site owner, depending on the content of each page. There's no automatic or rotating ad system — placement is intentional and based on context. These are not external advertisements and don't match the criteria for blocking as described in your policy. The widgets provide useful search and price comparison functionality, offering additional value to readers of travel content, similar to how comments or chats extend page functionality.

2. The specific implementation on nashaniva.com does not represent our standard guidelines for widget placement. It violates our own terms of service, as the widget was inserted outside of any travel-related content. According to our guidelines, widgets must be placed within meaningful editorial travel content to provide context and value to users.

3. The current broad-spectrum blocking of our entire tp.media domain impacts thousands of legitimate travel bloggers and content creators who properly implement our widgets as part of their editorial content.

We request that you consider a more targeted approach by limiting any necessary blocking to the specific implementation on nashaniva.com rather than affecting our entire domain. This would align with your stated policy of minimizing false positives and avoiding over-blocking of legitimate content.

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Странно, похоже что дело не в фильтрах. Попробуйте их отключить вместе с остальными модулями в программе кроме `Защиты от трекинга`. Если проблема останется, отключайте опции этого модуля по одному.

> Также дополню, что в HTTPS-фильтрации добавил в исключениях оба сайта!

На время тестирования их лучше удалить из исключений HTTPS, иначе они не будут фильтроваться.

comment.body: Да, уведомления в браузере разрешены, еще раз проверил - оба сайта там есть. Фильтры, вообще, все отключил. Помогает только отключение HTTPS-фильтрации или отключение AdGuard. Kaspersky я отключил, тоже не помогло. Самое странное, что в Firefox уведомления приходят нормально с включенной HTTPS-фильтрацией и AdGuard.

# Creating the pull request ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [ ] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address Original issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/203249 ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Your comment `ilgiorno.it`, ` ilrestodelcarlino.it` and `quotidiano.net` have the same issue, so I propose the same solution. 2. Screenshots
### Terms - [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.body:
## The next song does not start with AdGuard extension v5, because of `ERR_UNSAFE_REDIRECT`

## Reported to devs:

https://issues.chromium.org/issues/375395102

Please leave a comment or `+1` the bug there

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c217f1ea-5ef9-4373-adc0-7228bfde19dc)

comment.body:
> Hi, thanks for your great extension! As you may know, the web version of Spotify starts playing ads after a few songs. Until recently, your extension was effectively removing the ads, ensuring no interruptions between songs. However, lately, even when the extension is active, Spotify still enters ad-play mode. No ads are actually played, but the website seems to freeze, and I have to refresh the page.

Hi. Please read:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/192282#issue-2633691785

Also I recommend to `+1` the bug in the Chromium bug tracker 
https://issues.chromium.org/issues/375395102

comment.body:
Sites can try to check ports. For example, if remote control app is running, they will abort purchase process. Or sites of router vendors. They can't load data. If there was a vulnerability, it would have been fixed in the browser, like `0.0.0.0` issue.

Do you know real site, which makes dangerous requests to LAN?

comment.body:
We may make the rules a bit simpler

```suggestion
reclameaqui.com.br#$#div[data-testid="complete-header"] > div[data-testid="banner-container"] { display: none !important; }
reclameaqui.com.br#$#div[data-testid="complete-header"] > div[data-testid="banner-container"] + header > div[style="top:90px"] { top: 0 !important; }
```
Maybe the scriptlet is not necessary if the banner can be hidden?

`0px` = `0` without `px` is legal value.

comment.body:
Не повторяется с вашими настройками.
Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение ~60 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

issue.body:
# Creating the pull request ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [ ] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address Original issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/203249 ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Your comment `ilgiorno.it`, ` ilrestodelcarlino.it` and `quotidiano.net` have the same issue, so I propose the same solution. However, could be `##div[class*=" amp__watermark"]` be better then `##div[class$=" amp__watermark"]` ? 2. Screenshots
### Terms - [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met
